pros: Great work culture. IV Team, tele techs, almost always have an aid and bonuses are offered regularly. PCU management very good and understanding. Usually only 3-4 patients on days. Seldom have I had 5 patients. Never had more than 5 on tele!
cons: Sometimes understaffed. Meditech is a little outdated. Pay not as high as some other hospitals. They say they will get rid of bonuses.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Sellersville, PA
pros: Good support staff understanding management
cons: Overtime, need to hire more people

pros: Great community hospital, patients were wonderful, great medical staff, some amazing nurses
cons: Inconsistent hours (hours cut frequently if census was low), staff favoritism by management, poor monitoring of/no consequences to low performers, uneven workload/assignments

pros: Poor pay but great environment to work in
cons: Pay is not competitive, could get $10 more an hour elsewhere

pros: Close-knit staff. Family environment. Multiple specialists available for consultation.
cons: Staffing can be somewhat sparse at times

pros: Small hospital with a family feel. Everyone is very friendly and you get to know many staff on a first name basis. Very low turnover and many staff have been around 20+ years. Compensation is fair. Many upgrades in the works with the new wing.
cons: Some systems and decor outdated. Experienced staff sometimes do not want upgrades/updates.

pros: Nice office. Helpful staff. No micromanaging
cons: Pay could be better. Attitudes, drama, between staff and surgeons.

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Sellersville, PA
pros: The people and community are typically great!
cons: Care for their employees could be shown better. Short staffing just means more work, which shows that we can do it without more people, so they dont do much about getting any new people. Their descriptions and advertisements for jobs is greatly lacking in this department, too.

pros: No Pros company is horrible
cons: HR is disrespectful, you are talked to like a piece of dirt and always will be put down. They could care less about their employees

review_title: Poor hourly wages in Urgent Care
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Sellersville, PA
pros: flexible schedule, lots of PTO
cons: lack of management, little to no guidance, takes months to get any replies, low wages, no support, no room for growth.

review_title: People don't work at GVH for the money
pros: Small community hospital with peers that really care about each other. Clean environment. No coworker drama. Short commute for those in the burbs.
cons: Management gets no where with employee requests and recommendations because the board shuts them down. Employee concerns are addressed with vague responses and buying themselves time. No bonus pay at some areas. No raises other than the cost of living 2%. Getting paid several dollars less here than other places.

pros: Ample opportunity for overtime and extra money
cons: Management, communication, benefits only suited towards GVH physicians

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Sellersville, PA
pros: Always overtime. Some of the people really weren’t too bad.
cons: Horrible pay, lots of drama was bosses.

pros:
Safe environment
Great Training
alot of Work space
cons:
You're required to sit for hours at a time very unhealthy especially if you are full time.
Microaggressions constantly. Can be frustrating if you are POC
Software tends to crash which increases the amount of time for a task to be completed efficiently

pros: Penn medicine Collaborated so maybe there will be change
cons: Mismanaged, horrible emr system, lower end of average pay

review_title: Community Feel Hospital, but not progressive. Comfortable with keeping the culture how they want it.
pros:
Awesome co-workers
Personal community feel atmosphere 
Close to home
Colleagues are personable. Everyone knows your name. 
Orientation training is appropriate in length for individual learning needs
Flexible. self-scheduling on some units
Options for healthcare with low out of pocket premiums.
cons:
Low, low ....LOW pay!!! Not competitive at all for this era.
Mediocre healthcare coverage. High premiums and co-pays for average coverage. 
Hospital culture stuck in the stone ages. 
No collaborative voice given to bedside nurses. 
Managers tend to pretend to care but do little to deliver needed changes that are brought to their attention.

pros: the pros to this job involve, flexibility, independence, leadership, teamwork, family-like atmosphere, I really enjoyed working there because of the holiday bonus
cons: I cannot think of a con, maybe just that there are some people who are not nice and are not good people persons and the lack of interest in employee health and wellness

pros: Love the people I work with
cons: Does not have enough staff

pros: Management, work during the week most times.
cons: Work when others call in. A lot of time working nighs with no extra help for months on end almost years

pros: Great place to work especially if you’re a nursing student or planning a career in the medical field. Very supportive work environment.
cons: Sometimes understaffed but this happens at all hospitals

pros: Local, family feel, making an impact
cons: Low pay, not a lot of opportunity for growth

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Elkins Park, PA
pros: Majority of the people that I work with are wonderful including some of the supervisors.
cons: Some supervisors don't care for your wellbeing and only care about what they can get out of you. The hospital is very understaffed.

pros: I like serving doctors, nurses and patients.
cons: Lowest paying job in hospital. No room for advancement.

pros: Friendly employee and Opportunity for overtime
cons: Like all hospitals, poor staffing

pros: benefits, easy work-life schedule, career mobility
cons: starting wage needs some improvement

review_title: No  Advancement to Other Depts HR is Clueless
pros: Some of the people and they have decent eye insurance
cons: No advancement to other departments, HR department does not know anything about the jobs employees do there, HR department doesn't follow it's Attendance policy.

pros: has good pay and benefits
cons: you work worse than an animal

review_title: Make you choose between sick and vacation time
pros: Hospital has a good reputation.
cons:
The HR department does not disclose a very important benefits information during hiring process. Every time an employee calls out sick first day comes out of so called Personal Annual Leave (PAL) time that you accrue for vacation and holidays. If you out sick for more than a day, 25% of it comes out of PAL. The whole policy is rotten in my opinion because one can never predict a sickness. And if you take a vacation and run out of PAL you might and up with unpaid sick time. And this policy is imposed on people working in a hospital where they are exposed to sickness every single day.
They also make employees punch in and out even if you are experienced IT professional. I am surprised they don't force doctors to do the same.

review_title: a bomb waiting to go off.
pros: the only good thing about working at grand view is if you need experience in the medical field, they can give it to you easy. you'll get the experience and maybe if you're lucky you'll realize that the medical field is not the way to go as far as hospital settings.
cons: Overworked, taken advantage of, usually in charge of 14 patients per worker, coworkers are disrespectful, makes promises and doesn't keep them.

review_title: Great past, but losing the family feeling
pros: As a hospital, a great place for quality care and treatment of patients regardless of income or background. Practitioners and nurses really focus on doing it right the first time.
cons: Recent changes in nursing admin have changed the atmosphere to where there is more emphasis on bottom dollar than on employees. Concept of self governance exists on paper but not practice. Management style is very top-down.

pros: Pays for different background checks,  surprisingly.
cons: Too many to list here

review_title: Great High School and College Job
job_title: Food Service Aide in Sellersville, PA
pros: The compensation is good, the hours are flexible, the managers are fair, and the co-workers are friendly. It was a great work environment as a younger person to help me as I continued my education. They would always try and help accommodate me with hours around my class schedules.
cons: The bosses tend to micro-manage and vacation/time off request system is poorly managed. There was an 8 hour training session that had little to no information on kitchen jobs.

pros: Great people, competitive salary, friendly, good patients. I started in October. In January I got an increase of salary right away. At other companies, I would have had to wait a year and 3 months to get a raise. There is room for advancement. Within 6 months I was promoted. For those that work hard, you will be rewarded.
cons: Hours can be bad based upon where you are working and you do have to work holidays, however, this comes with all jobs in healthcare.

review_title: People are a pleasure to work with.
pros: It's a nice place of work. On the units it's a fast pace. Your days go by quick but always a pleasure to work with the wonderful and knowledgeable nurses and genuine aides.
cons: Communication is sometimes a challenge. It's hard work and a lot on your body lifting and running around if your an aide.

pros: Love working in a hospital.  Most of the staff is very friendly.  It is a good feeling being able to help people when they are at one of their lowest times.
cons: Management does not value staff.  Staff to patient ratio gets a little to high at times and level of care is hard to maintain.

pros: The people are nice and that's because everyone in in the same situation.
cons: overworked and underpaid! PTO system does not make sense, on holidays you don't work they take it out of your PTO to pay you. Even though you collect sick days, if you call out sick(unless its 2 or more days) that also comes out of your PTO.  So you will have all of these sick days collected but with no PTO.

pros: Employees opinions are respected and valued, work is valued and appreciated.  Many advancement opportunities for those who seek them and work for them. Great heath benefits and generous time off.
cons: Not many cons to think of. To some the community hospital "feel" can be a con but to most it's a plus - it's a matter of perspective!

pros: Co-workers really care, try to help patients and each other
cons: HR, management, administration, benefits. Very slow to hire new employees.

pros: You spend a lot of time away from department therefore a lot of time away from the supervisor lead tech and manager. There is almost nobody without some sort of fake specialty title. They all want to be the boss and nobody wants to do the work
cons: Very clique-y. You'll do well if you are young and pretty (male OR female). Skill and experience count for very little.

pros: Management is friendly and professional.  Grand View has a built in sort of community.  The reputation of the hospital and the benefits offered to employees are also pluses.
cons: Working in the Children's Center it is sometimes difficult for a teacher to accommodate to an age range of 6 wks to (during the summer) 12 years.

pros: Co workers were the best!
cons: Management.  Earned my ASN while working at GV.  After graduation GV would not hire me as a Registered Nurse.  So insulting.  After 18+ years of working for them.

pros: The people I work with are amazing!, The word team applies to the staff here.
cons: None that I can think of at this time.

review_title: nice to work close to home
pros: great PAL time, great benefits, friendly, community based
cons: pay is low compared to the industry an no  incentives

pros: Great experience for a short time period; small company feel
cons: Senior management needs turnover; Don't buck the system

pros: Coworkers were the only plus.
cons: Low pay and no upward mobility.

pros: Great people and support, work is not bad
cons: Pay is low compared to other hospitals

pros: Generally good people looking to help patients and learn
cons: Senior Management completely disconnected from staff.

pros: Great nurses on every floor
cons: Terrible management and CNO, unsafe staffing ratios
